items.title: Highways Have Sliced Through City After City. Can the U.S. Undo the Damage?
items.abstract: The Biden administration is funding projects around the country aimed at reconnecting communities that have been divided by transportation infrastructure.

items.title: China’s Cities Are Buried in Debt, but They Keep Shoveling It On
items.abstract: China has long pursued growth by public spending, even after the payoff has faded. Cities stuck with the bill are still spending — and cutting essential services.

items.title: 6 Cities on 5 Continents That Are Reimagining Urban Life
items.abstract: What we can learn from creative city initiatives, from Sydney to Paris.

items.title: Can Anything Be Done to Assuage Rural Rage?
items.abstract: Rural voters blame the wrong people, but their troubles are real.

items.title: Holland Tunnel Out of New York City Will Close Overnight Through 2025
items.abstract: New Jersey-bound traffic will be barred for several hours six nights a week while crews repair decade-old damage from Hurricane Sandy.
